1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

2.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to surround, i.e. protect or aid
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)

3.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
support or (by implication) ability, i.e. (direct) help, (in purpose) an undertaking, (intellectual) understanding

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

4.brief: properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
a puff, i.e. wind, angry or vital breath, divine inspiration, intellect. or (concretely) an animal
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

5.brief: properly, lax, i.e. (figuratively) a ghost (as dead; in plural only)
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)

6.brief: Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

7.brief: to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as aquarter (gloomy and unknown)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a desolation (of surface), i.e. desert; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

8.brief: to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.

9.brief: to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud

10.brief: an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness

11.brief: a column (as standing); also a stand, i.e. platform
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, to triturate (in a mortar), i.e. (figuratively) to agitate (by concussion)

12.brief: vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
properly, to toss violently and suddenly (the sea with waves, the skin with boils); figuratively (in a favorable manner) to settle, i.e. quiet; specifically, to wink (from the motion of the eye-lids)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
to dash asunder; by implication, to crush, smash or violently plunge; figuratively, to subdue or destroy

13.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a fugitive, i.e. the serpent (as fleeing), and the constellation by that name

14.brief: a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
